results.abstract: 7 mil test pilots chosen by NASA to be trained as 1st Mercury Astronauts; will start 2 yrs of training at Langley Research Center, Hampton, Va; all are married, described as 'highly motivated'; final choice for orbital flight seen made on actual launching day sometime in '61

headline.main: Seven Pilots Picked For Satellite Trips; 7 CHOSEN BY U. S. AS SPACE PILOTS

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 6 -Seven military test pilots have been selected to undergo training as the nation's first astronauts.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 6 -Seven military test pilots have been selected to undergo training as the nation's first astronauts.

results.abstract: capsule to be launched by Atlas missile, orbit 2-3 times

headline.main: SCIENTISTS GIVE SPACE TRIP DATA; Astronaut Will Circle Earth and Land in Atlantic -- Parachutes Slow Fall

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 9 -- The first Mercury Astronaut to fly off into space will circle the earth two or three times before returning to a soft and safe landing in the Atlantic Ocean.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 9 -- The first Mercury Astronaut to fly off into space will circle the earth two or three times before returning to a soft and safe landing in the Atlantic Ocean.

results.abstract: specifications for educ and flight experience led to choice of men in 30's

headline.main: Astronaut Requirements Led to Men in Their 30's

headline.main: 7 NAMED AS PILOTS FOR SPACE FLIGHTS SCHEDULED IN 1961; One Will Be Aboard Nation's First Manned Satellite -- Rigid Training Ahead 7 NAMED AS PILOTS FOR SPACE FLIGHTS

results.snippet: Thus last week the Administration and organized labor presented their conflicting points of view on the seriousness of the unemployment problem -- the Administration confident that it will cease to be a major problem, labor convinced that strong...
results.lead_paragraph: Thus last week the Administration and organized labor presented their conflicting points of view on the seriousness of the unemployment problem -- the Administration confident that it will cease to be a major problem, labor convinced that strong action is needed.
